content: quote: Originally posted by klassylady25: What reports? Here are two 2007 articles which speak of KSM's two children, then 7 and 9 years old, who were detained and questioned in September 2002, after his capture: "http://uk.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUKN0644490320070607?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=0" "http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/03/09/1047144871940.html" The Human Rights Watch report, from which some of the information in the Reuters article was taken, goes on to say how they were questioned. Second-hand reports from family members of other captured Pakistanis, say that KSM's children were coerced by placing ants on them. Here's a transcript from the DoD's Defenselink: "http://www.defenselink.mil/news/transcript_ISN10020.pdf" Also, the book The One Percent Doctrine,, written by Ron Suskind, speaks of the threats to his children's lives. His reported response to the threat was that they'll "be in a better place" following their deaths. That book was written a year before the Reuters article was published. The German paper (somewhat tabloid-like) Der Spiegel interviewed Suskind, and he repeats his assertion. "http://www.spiegel.de/international/0,1518,445117,00.html" Again, I can't personally verify this information, it's why I'm saying that there are "reports" that such activity took place. But you asked, so there it is...
quote: Originally posted by klassylady25: What reports?
reply: Here are two 2007 articles which speak of KSM's two children, then 7 and 9 years old, who were detained and questioned in September 2002, after his capture: "http://uk.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUKN0644490320070607?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=0" "http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/03/09/1047144871940.html" The Human Rights Watch report, from which some of the information in the Reuters article was taken, goes on to say how they were questioned. Second-hand reports from family members of other captured Pakistanis, say that KSM's children were coerced by placing ants on them. Here's a transcript from the DoD's Defenselink: "http://www.defenselink.mil/news/transcript_ISN10020.pdf" Also, the book The One Percent Doctrine,, written by Ron Suskind, speaks of the threats to his children's lives. His reported response to the threat was that they'll "be in a better place" following their deaths. That book was written a year before the Reuters article was published. The German paper (somewhat tabloid-like) Der Spiegel interviewed Suskind, and he repeats his assertion. "http://www.spiegel.de/international/0,1518,445117,00.html" Again, I can't personally verify this information, it's why I'm saying that there are "reports" that such activity took place. But you asked, so there it is...
title: Waterboarding

content: quote: Originally posted by klassylady25: What reports? Here are two 2007 articles which speak of KSM's two children, then 7 and 9 years old, who were detained and questioned in September 2002, after his capture: "http://uk.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUKN0644490320070607?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=0" "http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/03/09/1047144871940.html" The Human Rights Watch report, from which some of the information in the Reuters article was taken, goes on to say how they were questioned. Second-hand reports from family members of other captured Pakistanis, say that KSM's children were coerced by placing ants on them. Here's a transcript from the DoD's Defenselink: "http://www.defenselink.mil/news/transcript_ISN10020.pdf" Also, the book The One Percent Doctrine,, written by Ron Suskind, speaks of the threats to his children's lives. His reported response to the threat was that they'll "be in a better place" following their deaths. That book was written a year before the Reuters article was published. The German paper (somewhat tabloid-like) Der Spiegel interviewed Suskind, and he repeats his assertion. "http://www.spiegel.de/international/0,1518,445117,00.html" Again, I can't personally verify this information, it's why I'm saying that there are "reports" that such activity took place. But you asked, so there it is...
quote: Originally posted by klassylady25: What reports?
reply: Here are two 2007 articles which speak of KSM's two children, then 7 and 9 years old, who were detained and questioned in September 2002, after his capture: "http://uk.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUKN0644490320070607?pageNumber=2&virtualBrandChannel=0" "http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/03/09/1047144871940.html" The Human Rights Watch report, from which some of the information in the Reuters article was taken, goes on to say how they were questioned. Second-hand reports from family members of other captured Pakistanis, say that KSM's children were coerced by placing ants on them. Here's a transcript from the DoD's Defenselink: "http://www.defenselink.mil/news/transcript_ISN10020.pdf" Also, the book The One Percent Doctrine,, written by Ron Suskind, speaks of the threats to his children's lives. His reported response to the threat was that they'll "be in a better place" following their deaths. That book was written a year before the Reuters article was published. The German paper (somewhat tabloid-like) Der Spiegel interviewed Suskind, and he repeats his assertion. "http://www.spiegel.de/international/0,1518,445117,00.html" Again, I can't personally verify this information, it's why I'm saying that there are "reports" that such activity took place. But you asked, so there it is...
title: Waterboarding
